author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of Tamil Nadu Government Fair Price Shop Employees Union, employed by Tamil Nadu Cooperative Societies, staged a demonstration in front of the Collectorate here on Thursday, pressing for their 13-point charter of demands.

District president of the union V. P. Dinakaran, who led the agitation, said that the demonstration was to draw the attention of the authorities to the anomalies in salaries after the government passed a Government Order recently, revising the pay scales of employees.

After the G.O. was passed in November, there were pay differences of employees who had completed 10 years of service.

The pay scales of those who had completed 10 years of service in Chennai and other districts should be equal but there were differences after the GO was passed in November, he said.

No pay parity

The agitation was also to urge the government to ensure equal pay for fair price shop employees, employed by Tamil Nadu Civil Supplies Corporation (TNCSC) and those employed by the cooperative societies. Both the employees carried out the same work but there was no pay parity, he said.

P. Gnanasekaran, district secretary of the union, said that they staged the demonstration in the evening after completing their work and handing over the month-end accounts to the authorities, in order to ensure that there was no inconvenience to the public, he said.

Solidarity

K. Muthukumar, district secretary of Tamil Nadu Government Employees Union, and other office-bearers joined the stir, expressing solidarity with the fair price shop employees.
title: Protest to draw attention to pay anomalies
